intro: Capraria biflora subsp. havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban capraria, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are clustered in terminal racemes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
